titleStmt.title: An exact abridgment in English, of The commentaries, or reports of the learned and famous lawyer, Edmond Plowden, an apprentice of the common law. Concerning diverse cases and matters in law, and the arguments thereupon; in the times of the reignes of King Edward the Sixth, Queen Mary, King Philip, and Queen Mary, and Queen Elizabeth, with the exceptions to the pleadings, and answers thereunto; the resolutions of the matters in law, and all other principall matters arising upon the same. By F.H. of the Inner Temple London, Esq;
titleStmt.author: Plowden, Edmund, 1518-1585.

titleStmt.title: An exact abridgment in English, of The commentaries, or reports of the learned and famous lawyer, Edmond Plowden, an apprentice of the common law. Concerning diverse cases and matters in law, and the arguments thereupon; in the times of the reignes of King Edward the Sixth, Queen Mary, King Philip, and Queen Mary, and Queen Elizabeth, with the exceptions to the pleadings, and answers thereunto; the resolutions of the matters in law, and all other principall matters arising upon the same. By F.H. of the Inner Temple London, Esq;
titleStmt.author: Plowden, Edmund, 1518-1585.
Hicks, Fabian.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R. White, and T. Roycroft, for Henry Twyford, and are to be sold at his shop in Vine Court in the Middle Temple,

notesStmt.note: "Newis and his wife, against Larke and others" (caption title) begins new pagination; register is continuous.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
